H0.text: Specific gravity is the value you can read from a glass hydrometer that is filled with air, weighted with lead at the bottom, floats highest in the densest fluids, and has been calibrated and labeled accordingly.

H1.text: Volume is what you read from the glass hydrometer that is filled with air, weighted with lead at the bottom, floats highest in the densest fluids, and has been calibrated and labeled.

H2.text: Mass is what the calibrated and labeled glass hydrometer, which is filled with air, weighted with lead at the bottom, displays when it floats highest in the densest fluids.

H3.text: Density is the value that can be read from a glass hydrometer filled with air and weighted with lead at the bottom, which floats highest in the densest fluids and has been calibrated and labeled for that purpose.

A4.text: The relative density of the unknown liquid can be calculated from the change in displacement of the hydrometer.

A5.text: The hydrometer has been calibrated and labeled accordingly.
